description: Fits a beta-binomial model to overdispersed binomial data.
General function for d-prime estimation from various discrimination methods (e.g., 2AFC, Triangle, Duo-Trio).
Thurstonian model for 2-Alternative Choice (Yes/No) tasks, estimating sensitivity (delta) and bias (tau).
Degree of Difference (DoD) analysis, estimating d-prime and boundary parameters (tau).
Same-Different method analysis, estimating sensitivity (delta) and criterion (tau).
Tests a d-prime value against a hypothesized value, possibly for multiple groups.
Compares d-prime values from multiple groups to test for equality.
Signal Detection Theory analysis for rating scales, calculating z(Hit rate), z(False alarm rate), and d-prime for each criterion.
Calculates the Area Under the ROC Curve (AUC) from d-prime.
Maps d-prime to proportion correct for various discrimination methods.
Maps proportion correct to d-prime for various discrimination methods.
Calculates the derivative of the psychometric function (psyfun) with respect to d-prime.
Rescales values between proportion correct (pc), proportion discriminated (pd), and d-prime (dp) scales, optionally transforming standard errors.
Returns the chance performance (pguess) for a given discrimination method.
Converts proportion correct (pc) to proportion discriminated (pd).
Converts proportion discriminated (pd) to proportion correct (pc).
